text:
So.  How is everyone dealing with GDPR compliance.  I thought I had an efficient process in place for our clients, but upon testing, it doesn't seem so efficient anymore.

Here was the planned process:

1. Create a list of all european contacts.
2. Send that list an email notifying of GDPR compliance and providing them with a form including "Notice and Consent/Legitimate Interest (GDPR) fields so they can opt in.
3. Immediately after sending this opt in email to that list, opt all list users out of email communication.

Problems: after opting a user out of email communication, merely submitting the form with the "I agree to communications" checkbox ticked does not opt that user back in; they need to access a subscription preferences page and re-opt in.
Could you use a workflow to update the user subscription preference based on the value of that "I agree to communications" checkbox?
I thought HubSpot had some sort of double opt in type thing
They do have a new tool for the GDPR
I'm having trouble figuring out how to trigger that workflow.  <@U26BLKGE4> updating that value doesn't actually update a contact property
oh wait... it does seem to update a contact property called " Legal basis for processing contact's data"

For anyone with GDPR questions, I would recommend checking out this "playbook" page which talks about all of the capabilities we built -- <https://www.HubSpot.com/data-privacy/gdpr/HubSpot-product-playbook>

Hi all – wondering if it is possible to use a CTA Hubl reference within a custom module with boolean logic. I have a custom module that lets the end user check off which content offer they want to see on a blog post (within this offer there is a CTA that says, "yes please") this then takes you to a landing page... Only problem is when you use the embed CTA code, HubSpot does not properly track analytics on the CTA
example post: <https://www.calypso.agency/blog/how-to-excel-at-your-next-media-interview> (see bottom of post) square content offer that says The Essential Guide to Preparing Your Brand for Crisis

If someone goes to the email preferences/subscription page and checks the box for the blog emails, which blog email are they getting subscribed to (daily, monthly, etc)? Right now, I don’t think they’re getting any of the blog emails even if they check this box. Can someone shed some light on how this checkbox connects to the blog emails?
Question for you all. How often do you use static text in your custom modules?
almost never, I try to make it so text is always changeable by the people in the page editor
I’ll do that on occasion if it’s a module used on a non-editable page like the blog listing.
Or if the client, when given the ability to change copy on a page, goes mad with power and starts using the backend for evil and despotic purposes.
